meanings.definition: To play truant or skip school.
meanings.sent1: Tom decided to mitch school and go to the park instead.
meanings.sent2: The students were caught trying to mitch class by hiding in the library.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to mitch its responsibilities by napping all day.
meanings.sent4: The sun mitched behind the clouds, casting a shadow over the playground.
meanings.sent5: The idea of mitching school seemed thrilling but risky to Sarah.

meanings.definition: A person who plays truant or skips school.
meanings.sent1: The principal warned the young mitch about the consequences of skipping classes.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends considered themselves the cool mitches of the school.
meanings.sent3: The little mitch pretended to be sick to avoid going to school.
meanings.sent4: The old tree in the schoolyard was known as the meeting spot for the mitches.
meanings.sent5: The new student felt like an outsider among the seasoned mitches in the class.
